trans-unit.source: The LdapConnection class creates a TCP/IP or UDP LDAP connection to Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services or an LDAP server.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property on the LdapConnection object and <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.QueryClientCertificate%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions> object are both set, the certificate specified in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property is ignored.
The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier.
The logon credentials and the Negotiate Authentication are used to connect to the LDAP server.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.
The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified server.
A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server.
Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the right end of the string by a colon (:).
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier and network credentials.
Negotiate Authentication is used.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
A <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> object that specifies the credentials to use.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.

The LdapConnection constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> class using the specified directory identifier, network credentials, and authentication type.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server.
A <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> object that specifies the credentials to use.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType"></xref> values that specifies the type of authentication to use.
Thrown if it fails to create a connection block or fails to open a connection to server.
Thrown when authType is out of range.
Thrown when authType is specified as Anonymous but credential specified credentials.
The Abort method cancels the asynchronous request.
A <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that references the asynchronous request.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null ( in Visual Basic).
Thrown if asyncResult was not returned by the corresponding call to
The AuthType property contains the supported authentication types.
A supported authentication type.
Thrown when authType is out of range.
The AutoBind property specifies whether an automatic bind is allowed.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the automatic bind is allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
A value from <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing"></xref> enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> function.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the state data for this request.
A <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that references the asynchronous send.
The object handle is not valid.
request is ( in Visual Basic).
Partial results are not supported.
A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to .
The BeginSendRequest method sends data asynchronously to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
The time, in seconds, until the request times out.
A value from <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultProcessing"></xref> enumeration that specifies the level of partial result to return.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> function.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the state data for this request.
A <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that references the asynchronous send.
The object handle is not valid.
request is null ( in Visual Basic).
Partial results are not supported.
A callback function must be specified if partialMode is equal to .
The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the current credentials.
The object handle is not valid.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to one of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error codes.

Either the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates*> property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType*> property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.
The Bind method sends an LDAP bind using the specified <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential>.
A <xref:System.Net.NetworkCredential> object that specifies the credentials to use.
The object handle is not valid.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.

Either the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates*> property specifies more than one client certificate to send for authentication, or the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection.AuthType*> property is Anonymous and one or more credentials are supplied.
The Credential property contains the network credentials for the object.
The network credentials for the object.
The Dispose method closes and releases the LDAP handle.
The Dispose method closes the connection and optionally releases the LDAP handle.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the handle is released when the connection is closed or <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the connection is closed without releasing the handle.
The EndSendRequest method completes an asynchronous request.
An <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that contains state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the results of the request.
Thrown if the object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null ( in Visual Basic).
asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the call.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.

The Finalize method allows an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object to attempt to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> object is reclaimed by garbage collection.
The GetPartialResults method retrieves partial results of an asynchronous operation.
An <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object that contains state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.PartialResultsCollection"></xref> object that contains the partial results.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null ( in Visual Basic).
asyncResult does not match the asyncResult returned in the call.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.
The SendRequest method sends a single <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> as an LDAP v3 operation.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the response from the server.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null ( in Visual Basic).
Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.
The SendRequest method sends a single <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> as an LDAP v3 operation.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
The length of time, in seconds, until the request times out.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the response from the server.
The object is already disposed.
The object handle is not valid.
asyncResult is null ( in Visual Basic).
Request is of type DsmlAuthRequest.
The error code returned by LDAP does not map to a the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ResultCode"></xref> enumeration error code.
Thrown if the server returned a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object with an error.
The SessionOptions property contains an <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions"></xref> object that specifies the session options.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection> object and <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions.QueryClientCertificate%2A> property on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions> object are both set, the certificate specified in the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.ClientCertificates%2A> property is ignored.
An <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapSessionOptions"></xref> object that specifies the session options.
The Timeout property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> times out.
The length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.LdapConnection"></xref> times out.
